RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 90. Claiming Purse 20800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where E ntered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five F urlongs.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NITRO TIME rushed up the inside to set a pressured pace on the inside, made a bid to shake clear leaving the turn, then held on late to prove best, driving. LIVE FIRE tracked the early pace and made a bid on the inside to be gaining late but missed. TAP EM was settled early, saved ground on the turn and had a mild late rally on the inside to best the rest. KHAKI JACK pressed the pace three wide and faded in the drive. STANHOPE steadied shortly after the start, then had a belated rally. SPIKES SHIRL chased the pace three wide and weakened. NAUTICAL NATURE stalked the pace four to three wide and weakened. MY BLUE EYES failed to menace. U KANT WHIP IT was off a bit slow and checked after the start, then was not a factor. The rider on STANHOPE claimed foul against KHAKI JACK for interference leaving the gate, after reviewing the replays the STEWARDS disallowed the objection and left the race as is.

ENTRY.NAME: Nitro Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up inside, set pressured pace inside, clear 1/8, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Live Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid inside, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Tap Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground turn, mild late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Stanhope
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied after start, belated rally

ENTRY.NAME: Spikes Shirl
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: U Kant Whip It
ENTRY.OWNER: Kenwood Racing LLC and Degaetano and Pastore Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, checked start, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: My Blue Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Khaki Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, faded stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Nautical Nature
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3-4 wide, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Turf CR: 91. Claiming Purse 20800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowe d 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course it will be run on th e main track at One Mile. If more than 10 horses remain it will be run at One Mile and Seventy Yards.).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRITUAL KING was away alertly to set the pace on the inside while being well handled, drew out leaving the turn and then was ridden out to prove much the best. NICK PAPAGIORGIO was allowed to settle, swung out five wide leaving the turn and rallied, second best. SACHMO chased the pace on the inside and had no kick while besting the rest. COLBALOAF was four wide into the first turn, chased the pace on the outside and weakened. DYNAMITE KARMA stalked the early pace three wide, then was between rivals on the turn and tired. PAPAL LAW stalked the winner two wide and then was empty in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Papal Law
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, empty stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Sachmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, no kick, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Spiritual King
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, well handled, drew off, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Nick Papagiorgio
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, swung 5 wide, rallied, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamite Karma
ENTRY.OWNER: Premier Stable and Brown Jr Donald L
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, between horses turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Colbaloaf
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, chased outside, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REBEL INVASION pressed the pace three wide and then inherited a big lead when the pace setter went bad leaving the quarter pole, then maintained a safe margin to the wire to prove best, driving. CIRCLE P chased the pace in between rivals three wide, then finished well late to be clearly second best. MUSIC BOX DANCER was allowed to settle early, swung out four wide leaving the turn and had no rally, bested rest. INTERRUPTER was off slowly, advanced two wide on the turn, angled in leaving the three sixteenths and then had a belated rally on the inside. DRAMA KEY passed the tiring rivals. PENTATONIC chased the pace in between rivals and weakened. SONG OF THE EAST chased the pace on the outside, then angled out extremely wide to avoid the fallen rider by the quarter pole. HOLD MY BEER BRO chased the pace on the inside and weakened. CHASIN' WHISKEY was reserved early, then was guided wide to avoid the fallen rider by the quarter pole, no factor. PTERODACTYL set a pressured pace and shook clear by the quarter pole and then went bad and lost the rider, vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Hold My Beer Bro
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Music Box Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, swung 4 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Pentatonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Chasin' Whiskey
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, went wide to avoid incident, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Pterodactyl
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, bid, went bad 1/4, lost rider, van off

ENTRY.NAME: Circle P
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace between horses, 3 wide turn, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Song of the East
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace outside, angled wide to avoid spill,

ENTRY.NAME: Interrupter
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, angled in 3/16, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Drama Key
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Rebel Invasion
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid, inherited big lead, kept safe late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 15 Allowed 2 lbs. A Ra ce Since July 15 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOT FUDGE WARRIOR set a pressured pace two wide, made a bid to shake clear on the turn, then drew off leaving the turn and was kept to right handed crop to prove best. ARROGANTE was settled on the outside, came wide into the lane and finished well to be clearly second best. MORGANS COVE was reserved early, came three wide into the lane and had a belated rally. STASSI pressed the pace on the inside and weakened. MORE RANSOM was settled on the inside and had no rally. UNION FOLLY pressed the pace three wide and weakened. OUT OF AMMO was bumped hard at the start and off slowly, no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Stassi
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: More Ransom
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Out of Ammo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, off slow, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Fudge Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace 2 wide, bid turn, drew clear, drew off,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Union Folly
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Morgans Cove
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 3 wide, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Arrogante
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside, wide turn, came wide, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CERTAIN JUSTICE was settled early towards the inside, shifted out and advanced four wide on the turn, angled out to close on the outside to get up in time under a drive. WILD VINE was bumped at the start, rated early, made a four wide move on the turn, took over leaving the turn but could not hold off the winner late, second best. BEJUCO vied for the lead in between rivals, then dug in gamely in the drive but could not go with the top two late, held show award. ZAMBONI WARRIOR tracked the pace from between rivals on the turn, made a mild bid nearing the quarter pole, angled in leaving the turn but had no kick. BOOK RUNNER passed the tiring rivals. NORTHERN VIRGINIA failed to menace. Z MYSTIQUE rushed up on the inside and vied for the lead and stopped. ON THE CHILL vied for the lead three wide and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Z Mystique
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up inside, vied for lead, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Certain Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, 4 wide move turn, angled out, closed outside, up

ENTRY.NAME: Bejuco
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead between horses, dug in stretch, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Zamboni Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace between horses, angled in, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Book Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Virginia
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Vine
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, rated, 4 wide move, led, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: On the Chill
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, stopped

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 15. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Tribe Dawg LLC and Kline Thomas

RACE.FOOTNOTES: POCOPSON STATION was well rated, cut the corner leaving the turn and closed with a rush late to edged clear late, driving. WENTZ vied for the early lead between rivals, then made a two wide bid and dueled for the lead to the inside of JIMMY THE KID while in the two to three path, then had a long drive and out gamed that rival but was outfinished by the winner. JIMMY THE KID vied for the early lead on the outside, made a three to four wide bid on the turn to duel for command, but hung in the drive. COAST TO COAST vied for the lead on the inside fell back by the quarter pole, angled out leaving the turn and weakened. SHOWER THE PEOPLE showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Coast to Coast
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, angled out upper stretch, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Wentz
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied between horses, dueled 2 wide, long drive, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Pocopson Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated, cut corner upper stretch, closed inside, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Shower the People
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Jimmy the Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied outside, bid 3-4 wide, long drive, hung stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 15400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 15 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pric e $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN OCCASION was three wide into the first turn, dropped to the inside and was well rated, made a two wide bid nearing the quarter pole, drew clear leaving the turn and widened the margin to prove much the best, driving. SPINNING MUSICIAN set the pace on the inside, headed by the quarter pole and proved to be no match for the winner while second best. WONDER WATER chased the early pace on the inside, fell back on the inside, shifted out and was three wide by the quarter pole, angled out to the outside and was along for the show award. BLUEBERRY MASH was settled back early, came four wide into the lane and had no rally. MERCURY TEN prompted the pace three wide for six furlongs and then weakened. SWEEPIN HARD chased the pace two wide and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Wonder Water
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, fell back inside, 3 wide 1/4, angled out, got 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Spinning Musician
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, headed 1/4, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Blueberry Mash
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Haire Maria Montez
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, came 4 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Sweepin Hard
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Mercury Ten
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Occasion
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3 wide first turn, rated isw bid 2 wide, drew off stretch,driving
